bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Jennie Carroll, September 7, 1900

div1.p: Reed notifies Jennie Carroll of James Carroll's improved condition.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Jennie Carroll, September 7, 1900
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Septr 7, 1900
Dear Mrs. Carroll;
div1.p:
A Cable
message from Major Kean,
dated yesterday and
received, this morning,
by the Surgeon General,
says, “Doctor Carroll
is better, but not
out of danger”--
I think that this is
very encouraging, and I
am hoping that we
will have still better
news tomorrow-
He was taken sick
on August 31st- a
week ago to-day-
